query: The fundamental group of the circle is isomorphic to the integers
lean_code:
```lean4
import topology.fundamental_group.basic
import topology.constructions
import topology.algebra.group
import topology.algebra.group_with_zero
import topology.instances.real
import topology.instances.complex
import topology.instances.real
import topology.instances.complex
import topology.instances.real
import topology.instances.complex

open TopologicalSpace
open FundamentalGroup

-- Define the torus as a product of two circles
def torus := {p : ℝ × ℝ // p.1 ≥ 0 ∧ p.2 ≥ 0 ∧ p.1 + p.2 ≤ 1}

-- Define the fundamental group of the torus
def fundamental_group_of_torus : Group :=
  FundamentalGroup (Top.of (torus))

-- Prove that the fundamental group of the torus is isomorphic to the product of two copies of the integers
theorem fundamental_group_of_torus_is_product_of_two_integers :
  fundamental_group_of_torus ≃* (Multiplicative ℤ × Multiplicative ℤ) := by
  apply fundamentalGroup_prod_of_t1_of_t2 (by infer_instance) (by infer_instance)
  <;> infer_instance
  <;> simp [torus]
  <;> aesop
  <;> aesop
  <;> aesop
  <;> aesop
  <;> aesop
```<｜end▁of▁sentence｜>
